title: AI-Generated Faces in the Real World: A Large-Scale Case Study of Twitter Profile Images
abstract: arXiv:2404.14244v2 Announce Type: replace-cross  Abstract: Recent advances in the field of generative artificial intelligence (AI) have blurred the lines between authentic and machine-generated content, making it almost impossible for humans to distinguish between such media. One notable consequence is the use of AI-generated images for fake profiles on social media. While several types of disinformation campaigns and similar incidents have been reported in the past, a systematic analysis has been lacking. In this work, we conduct the first large-scale investigation of the prevalence of AI-generated profile pictures on Twitter. We tackle the challenges of a real-world measurement study by carefully integrating various data sources and designing a multi-stage detection pipeline. Our analysis of nearly 15 million Twitter profile pictures shows that 0.052% were artificially generated, confirming their notable presence on the platform. tldr: 该文章通过大规模案例研究Twitter用户资料图片，确认了AI生成图像在平台上的显著存在，并分析了其相关特征。
